questions.text: A second year student of MAMC is doing a project under Dr Gobind. He has developed a protein that binds to CD3 and blocks its interaction with TCR, which is composed of γ and δ subunits. Of the following, which organ is the student studying?
Which of the following is not true about the major histocompatibility complex?

options.label: A
options.text: Display peptide fragments of protein antigens for recognition by antigen specific T cells

options.label: B
options.text: Genes encoding HLA molecules are clustered on a small segment of chromosome 6

options.label: C
options.text: No two individuals are ever likely to express the same MHC molecules

options.label: D
options.text: Inheritance of particular HLA alleles increase the risk of autoimmune disorders

questions.correct_answer: C. No two individuals are ever likely to express the same MHC molecules
questions.explanation: Ans. C. No two individuals are ever are likely to express the same MHC molecules

questions.text: A young girl is stung by a bee while with her family at a school picnic. About 10 minutes later, she becomes nauseated and vomits twice, and shortly thereafter her parents notice that her face begins to swell and she begins to wheeze. Her parents rush her to the hospital, where treatment is administered. Which of the following statements best describes her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: The reaction is mediated by preformed IgG antibodies

options.label: B
options.text: She is having a type II hypersensitivity reaction

options.label: C
options.text: The most likely cause of her symptoms is foreign body ingestion

options.label: D
options.text: A similar reaction can occur in people given penicillin

questions.correct_answer: D. A similar reaction can occur in people given penicillin
questions.explanation: Ans. D. A similar reaction can occur in people given penicillin

questions.text: A 38-year-old female presents to the emergency room. She has recently been feeling weak and fatigued, unable to work out at the gym as she normally has in the past. Her trip to the emergency room is because she developed double vision today. Physical examination reveals ptosis. A CT scan of her body reveals a mass in the upper portion of the mediastinum. Of the following, what is the most likely mechanism for her conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: IgE-mediated release of inflammatory mediators from mast cells and basophils

options.label: C
options.text: Formation of immune complexes that deposit in tissues, triggering inflammation

options.label: D
options.text: Activation of T cells with recruitment of macrophages and cytokine release.

questions.text: 28 year lady Vimi notices that when she is outside in the sun for more than 1 hour, she develops a rash on her face. Laboratory studies show hemoglobin, 10 g/dL; platelet count, 155,000/mm3; and WBC count, 4100/mm3. Urinalysis shows no blood or glucose; there is 3+ proteinuria. The ANA test result is positive with a titer of 1: 2048 and a diffuse homogeneous immunofluorescent staining pattern. Which of the following is not true about condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Formation of immune complexes typically about 1 week after the injection of the protein

options.label: B
options.text: Organs like glomeruli and joints are preferred sites for deposition of immune complexes

options.label: C
options.text: Complexes that are of massive in size are the most pathogenic

options.label: D
options.text: Clinical features such as fever, urticaria, joint pain, lymph node enlargement, and proteinuria appear approximately 10 days after antigen administration.

questions.correct_answer: C. Complexes that are of massive in size are the most pathogenic
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Complexes that are of medium size, formed under conditions of slight antigen excess, are the most pathogenic

questions.text: Which of the following can be seen as a complication of the lady discussed in the previous question?

A 40 year old man has chronic cough with fever for several months. The chest radiograph reveals a diffuse reticulonodular pattern. Microscopically on transbronchial biopsy there are focal areas of inflammation containing epithelioid cell granuloma, Langhans giant cells, and lymphocytes. These findings are typical for which of the following type of hypersensitivity immunologic responses:
A super-antigen is a bacterial product that:

options.label: A
options.text: Binds to B7 and CD28 co-stimulatory molecules

options.label: B
options.text: Binds to the beta chain of TCR and MHC class II molecules of APC causing T cell activation

options.label: C
